report.title: A Vision of the Other World(s)
report.author: Brian
report.bodytext: I am a very curious person to say the least. I am a rational, pre-med student at an Ivy League university, with no belief in spiritual or divine realms. I bought a beginner's package of Salvia from a reputable site to just try it out and see what happens. This is not to say that I don't have respect for the effects! Quite the contrary, I am a very spiritual person with atheist beliefs. I thought Salvia might be an interesting experience given the historical and cultural lore surrounding the wonderful herb. /n /n My first experience with Salvia came on a quiet summer night. I was alone in my room at 1 a.m. when I decided to venture into the Salvia world. I turned the lights down low, lit a few tea light candles and packed a tobacco pipe about 3/4 full with leaves and sprinkled some 10x extract on for good measure. My first series of inhalations produced only minor effects that were probably a result of smoking something really fast. However, when I re-packed the pipe and went for round 2, I could never have expected what would be in store for me. /n /n Like so many others, I felt instantly boxed in. The best way to describe it is like I was wearing a suit of lead armor. I could move but a severe gravitational force made me realize my efforts were futile. I did not see the spirals or flashes of color that have been described here before. /n /n I placed my pipe down and buried my face into my pillow to releave the force of gravity. Immediately I was lost in another realm. I saw how everything worked. It sounds so cliche and nonsensical, but I was privy to knowledge of how reality functioned. It would be like if right this very second someone lifted the curtains and revealed the stage crew of life. /n /n I went on several 'trips' to unfamiliar and completely new surroundings. It reminded me of the movie 'It's a Wonderful Life' where the main character observes the world but cannot be seen or heard. I watched a Brooklyn family pack for their summer vacation. I met two invisible beings, but not human or even alien in shape. I could not see them but I knew they were there with me. They became my tour guides throughout the trip. I remember floating through my bedroom door and hovering over my own body and watching myself trip on Salvia. This was definitely the highlight of any Salvia trip I have been on! It was so fascinating and emotional to see myself. I cannot adequately explain the beauty of an out-of-body experience, it is something to be desired. /n /n The second most inspiring event took place after the out-of-body experience. I was laying on my side with my face buried in my pillow when I lost the distinction between the fabric and my skin. I felt like I was a part of the pillow and my arteries, veins, capillaries etc were all connected to the cotton fibers of the pillow case. All of a sudden, the pillow morphed into a beautiful old oak tree with amazing knotty roots. I became one of the roots and felt very warm and connected to the 'everything'. /n /n I have smoked Salvia several times after this experience and have always seen similar effects. I notice that there are elvish type creatures in my trips. They remind me of the elves that some people experience when taking Ayahuasca vine...maybe they are related in some respect? /n /n The length of my trip from start to finish was nearly 15 minutes. I reach climax very early on and sober up very quickly. For me, there is no down time on the trip, I go from max to min with little in between. I feel completely sober about 20min after the trip ends. There is a def. afterglow that must feel like prozac x10! Some of this sounds like stupid rambling and may come across as false or immature, but Salvia is one eye-opening and powerful plant. I smoke infrequently, not because I don't enjoy it, but because it cheapens the ritual aspect. Lady Salvia is a beautiful creature!
